func.title: SetObjectBlitMode

param.name: dwNewBlitMod
param.desc: New drawing mode (values see below). If 0 or unspecified, the object is reset to its definition blit mode. Otherwise bit 8 (user defined color value) is set implicitly.

param.name: overlay_id
param.desc: If specified, this will change the blit mode of the graphics overlay instead. The overlay must have been created using SetGraphics first.

func.desc: Changes the drawing mode of the object. The possible values correspond to the BlitMode value in the DefCore (see notice). This function returns the previously set blit mode.
func.remark: The blit mode does not affect additional overlay graphics. The blit mode of those must be set using SetGraphics.

row.col: Additive Modulation: the color of the modulation value is added to the object color, then RGB(128,128,128) is subtracted. Only base surface.
The color modulation set via SetClrModulation() applies to the base surface only and the overlay is normally colored by the owner color (see SetColor()).
The overlay (owner color) is drawn using additive modulation. This flag might have to be set independently of bit 2.
Draws the mesh as a wireframe. Only works with meshes!

User defined color value. This value can be specified if no special color mode is desired and to overwrite a DefCore setting. Also, this bit is set in the return value of this function and GetObjectBlitMode if the current blit mode of the object does not correspond to the definition blit mode.
Only for overlays: the blit mode of the base surface is used when drawing this overlay.

example.text:
Part of a scenario script: colors the selected clonk of the first player bright green for a while.
To handle the timing properly, it would be better to use an effect in order to avoid conflicts with other scripts that might change the color at the same time.
